about_the_game:
Dudelings: Arcade Sportsball

The First and Original "sportslike" Title.

Dudelings: Arcade Sportsball: the Soundtrack

The score that pretty much defines the next generation of arcade-y, vaguely sport-ish, tongue-in-cheek content.

What You Get

Eight full length tracks of Rock/Jazz/RnB/70s sports-inspired funkadelic goodness from one of the web's most underrated bands: The Brothers Nylon.

Plus three bonus alpha-stage audio tracks that kinda almost sound good!

Dudelings: Arcade Sportsball's OST is approximately 25 minutes of high-quality MP3 audio (320 bps).

The Full Experience

Join us on a journey of epic sonic proportions. From the pumped-up highs of "01 - Main Theme.mp3" to the emotional depths of "02 - Stadium.mp3" the range here is implacable. But we're not done yet! Oh no. We still have six other tracks before we've completed this sonic sojourn.

Pop "03 - City Streets.mp3" into your favorite media player and prepare to be transported to a darkened alleyway in a crime-infested part of Chicago, 1983. Just as fast as we've arrived, we make a break for it with "04 - Racing Heart.mp3", a high-speed chase through downtown LA in a buddy-cop 80's drama on VHS!

We ditch the police and pull up to our hideout, busting out the 2600 to play a game of Pong to the tune of "05 - Takin' A Break.mp3".

Boom. "06 - Infield.mp3" and ​the mood suddenly shifts. Gratuitous shots of a sultry femme fatale as she enters the door in slow motion. She has a dark, smokey voice, "I hear you boys are looking for work." You sheepishly nod as she lays out a devious plan. She tosses you a shake weight and says, "You're gonna need to bulk up, handsome."

CUT TO INTERIOR, HIDEOUT, DAYTIME, "07 - Workout Montage.mp3" plays diagetically from your headphones at first. It's time to get swole. And comedy ensues.

You and I? We're ready for our next mission. "08 - Beach Day.mp3" begins to play as we're posing as a couple of lifeguards on the beaches of Santa Monica. Suddenly, we see our mark and we pilfer his hotel key, break into his room's complementary safe, and ride off into the sunset.

Suddenly, a hooded figure stands on the horizon... "09 - Final Boss.flac" begins as anime speedlines emphasize the energy that has filled the space between us and him.

Your internal monolog becomes anxty and overly-wordy, "what is this hooded figure that has appeared before us and do we have the strength to defeat his untested power?"

I shout "Who are you?"

"Me?" The hooded man raises his head as the profile of of his mouth and chin are exposed to camera. He laughs n scene-chewing laugh as he summons a bowstaff from his cloak. "I'm Captain Dudeling."

You wonder to yourself if the Steam description for the DLC soundtrack counts as canon. Our eyes meet as we nod, you draw your sword and we prepare for battle.

These Guys Deserve A Grammy

Or... at least "Soundtrack of the Year" at the Game Awards.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Storage: 88 MB available space
  • Storage (high-quality audio): Additional 214 MB available space

short_description: The best part of Dudelings: Arcade Sportsball is now available as a complete album! This score was written and performed by The Brothers Nylon.
